slide1.title: Bhagavad Gita
slide1.subtitle: Guide to Life
slide1.description: Among ancient Hindu scriptures, the Bhagavad Gita holds a unique place. It is not just a religious text, but a guide to solving all problems of life.

slide2.title: Meditation & Contemplation
slide2.subtitle: Treasure of Spiritual Knowledge
slide2.description: Each verse of the Gita reveals the deeper meaning of life. Here you will find all the essentials for meditation, contemplation, and spiritual growth.

slide3.title: Begin Your Journey
slide3.subtitle: Your Spiritual Path
slide3.description: Start your spiritual journey today. Be enlightened by the wisdom of the Gita and make every moment of your life meaningful.

mangalacharan.title: Mangalacharan
mangalacharan.intro: Mangalacharan is the sacred hymn recited before reading the Gita. It calms our mind and prepares us for knowledge.
mangalacharan.mantraText:
Om Purnamadah Purnamidam Purnat Purnamudachyate.
Purnasya Purnamadaya Purnameva Vashishyate॥

Om Shantih Shantih Shantih॥

Om Narayanam Namaskrutya Naram Chaiva Narottamam.
Devim Sarasvatim Vyasam Tato Jayamudirayet॥

Om Bhadram Karnebhih Shrunuyama Devah.
Bhadram Pashyemakshabhiryajatraah.
Sthirairangaistushtuvamsastanubhih.
Vyashema Devahitam Yadayuh॥

Om Shantih Shantih Shantih॥
mangalacharan.meaningText: In this Mangalacharan, we pray to God that our knowledge, wisdom, and strength increase, and we can walk the path of truth.
instructions: Sit in a peaceful environment and recite the Mangalacharan
Begin reading the Gita after Mangalacharan

dhyana.title: Meditation
dhyana.introText: Meditation is an important means of spiritual development. It calms our mind and helps us connect with the soul.
dhyana.slokaText:
Dhyanam Paramam Brahmani Saccidanandarupini.
Tasmin Dhatrudhyeyabhavena Bhedo Nasti Kadachana॥

Dhyanam Manasi Samsthapya Paramatmani Chetasa.
Sarvabhuteshu Chaitanyam Samam Pashyati Yogi॥

Dhyanayogena Manasi Pashyanti Te Yuganuyugam.
Tasmin Dhatrudhyeyabhavena Bhedo Nasti Kadachana॥
dhyana.meaningText: Meditation is the concentration of mind on the Supreme Soul. When we meditate, our mind becomes calm and we experience oneness with God.
steps: Select a quiet and secluded place
Close your eyes and take deep breaths
When mind wanders, return to breathing

gitaMahatmya.title: Gita Mahatmya
gitaMahatmya.intro: The Gita is the essence of all Vedas. It provides solutions to all problems of life and shows the path to spiritual development.
gitaMahatmya.mahatmyaText:
Gitasupanishatsu Brahmavidyayam Yogashastre Shrikrishnarjunasamvade.
Arjunavishayogo Nama Prathmohadhyayah॥

Gitashastramida Punyam Yah Pathetam Narottamah.
Jnanavairagyasiddhartham Bhaktim Kurvan Govinde॥

Gitayah Shravanenaiva Smaranenaiva Va Narah.
Muchyate Sarvapapebhyo Vishnulokam Sa Gachhati॥
benefits: Freedom from sins and attainment of virtue

gitaSummary.title: Summary of Gita
gitaSummary.intro: The Gita is a sacred text divided into 18 chapters. Each chapter contains profound teachings about different aspects of life. Here is a brief description of the main content of each chapter.

1.title: Arjuna Vishada Yoga
1.summary: Arjuna's grief on the eve of the Kurukshetra war and the beginning of Krishna's counsel.

2.title: Sankhya Yoga
2.summary: Fundamental teachings on Karma Yoga, Jnana Yoga, and the immortality of the soul.

3.title: Karma Yoga
3.summary: The path to spiritual development through selfless action.

4.title: Jnana Karma Sannyasa Yoga
4.summary: The combination of knowledge and action, and various methods of yoga.

5.title: Karma Sannyasa Yoga
5.summary: The difference and coordination between renunciation of action and Karma Yoga.

6.title: Dhyana Yoga
6.summary: The teaching of self-control through meditation and yoga.

7.title: Jnana Vijnana Yoga
7.summary: The nature of God and the path to attaining God through devotion.

8.title: Akshara Brahma Yoga
8.summary: Meditation on the Supreme Soul and remembrance of God at the time of death.

9.title: Raja Vidya Raja Guhya Yoga
9.summary: The omnipresence of God and the glory of devotion.

10.title: Vibhuti Yoga
10.summary: Description of the glory and majesty of God.

11.title: Vishvarupa Darshana Yoga
11.summary: The vision of Krishna's universal form and Arjuna's fear.

12.title: Bhakti Yoga
12.summary: The supremacy of Bhakti Yoga and the qualities of a devotee.

13.title: Kshetra Kshetrajna Vibhaga Yoga
13.summary: The difference between Kshetra and Kshetrajna and the qualities of nature.

14.title: Gunatraya Vibhaga Yoga
14.summary: Description of Sattva, Rajas, and Tamas qualities and the path to liberation.

15.title: Purushottama Yoga
15.summary: The metaphor of the Ashvattha tree and the nature of the Supreme Soul.

16.title: Daivasura Sampada Vibhaga Yoga
16.summary: The difference between divine and demonic nature.

17.title: Shraddhatraya Vibhaga Yoga
17.summary: Description of three types of faith and penance.

18.title: Moksha Sannyasa Yoga
18.summary: The essence of the Gita and the means to attain liberation.

teachings: The immortality of the soul and the omnipresence of God
Observance of Dharma in all situations of life
